A registrant must display prominently throughout the assisted living residence evacuation procedures and a diagram of the location of emergency exits.
A registrant must ensure that the assisted living residence has emergency exits and egress windows that are appropriate to resident needs and capabilities.
A registrant must ensure that reliable communication equipment is accessible to all employees during an emergency.
A registrant must ensure that fire protection equipment is inspected, tested and maintained, in accordance with the recommendations, if any, of the manufacture.
A registrant must ensure that fire protection equipment is inspected, tested and maintained  at least annually.
A registrant must ensure that other emergency equipment is inspected, tested and maintained in accordance with the recommendations, if any, of the manufacturer.

A registrant must have first aid supplies readily accessible to all employees.

Nothing in subsection (2) or (3) prevents residents from preparing their own food or fluids.

A registrant must ensure that hospitality services are provided to residents in a manner thatdoes not jeopardize the health or safety of residents.

A registrant must ensure that a menu plan is developed thatis consistent with the recommendations set out in Canada's Food Guide.

Nothing in subsection (1) prevents residents from preparing their own meals, fluids or snacks.
A registrant must post or otherwise provide to residents the daily menu and meal times.

A registrant must provide to residents either personal laundry service or laundry equipment for resident use.

AssessmentIndDefinition.Name: A registrant who operates an assisted living residence to which this section applies must ensure that units for each class, and for residents and non-residents, are located in separate and distinct locations on the premises.
